alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 6:32PM EDT until August 11 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON...BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 631 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Cross to near Fort Sumter, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 620 PM, a wind gust to 53 mph was measured at Fort Sumter. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Moncks Corner, McClellanville, Fort Sumter, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange and Johns Island. This warning includes the following interstates: I-26 between mile markers 185 and 221. I-526 between mile markers 11 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
